Provider Facility Affiliations

Source: R/affiliations.R
affiliations.Rd

affiliations() allows the user access to data concerning providers' facility affiliations

Links:

  • Physician Facility Affiliations

  • Certification Number (CCN) State Codes

Update Frequency: Monthly

Usage

affiliations(
  npi = NULL,
  pac = NULL,
  first = NULL,
  middle = NULL,
  last = NULL,
  facility_type = NULL,
  facility_ccn = NULL,
  parent_ccn = NULL,
  offset = 0L,
  tidy = TRUE,
  na.rm = TRUE
)

Arguments

npi

< integer > 10-digit Individual National Provider Identifier

pac

< integer > 10-digit Individual PECOS Associate Control ID

first, middle, last

< character > Individual Provider's name

facility_type

< character >

  • "Hospital" or "hp"

  • "Long-term care hospital" or "ltch"

  • "Nursing home" or "nh"

  • "Inpatient rehabilitation facility" or "irf"

  • "Home health agency" or "hha"

  • "Skilled nursing facility" or "snf"

  • "Hospice" or "hs"

  • "Dialysis facility" or "df"

facility_ccn

< character > 6-digit CMS Certification Number of facility or unit within hospital where an individual provider provides service

parent_ccn

< integer > 6-digit CMS Certification Number of a sub-unit's primary hospital, should the provider provide services in said unit

offset

< integer > // default: 0L API pagination

tidy

< boolean > // default: TRUE Tidy output

na.rm

< boolean > // default: TRUE Remove empty rows and columns

Value

A tibble with the columns:

FieldDescription
npi10-digit NPI
pac10-digit individual PAC ID
firstIndividual provider's first name
middleIndividual provider's middle name
lastIndividual provider's last name
suffixIndividual provider's suffix
facility_typeCategory of facility
facility_ccnFacility's 6-digit CCN
parent_ccnPrimary facility's 6-digit CCN

Examples

if (FALSE) { # interactive()
affiliations(parent_ccn = 670055)
}
